title: 8 Ball Pool Timer and Rules
summary: Helps you referee 8 ball pool matches! (World Eightball Pool Federation rules)
developerAddress:
PO Box 71
Black Forest, SA 5035
Australia
description: This app helps you to umpire (referee) Eightball pool matches (using World Eightball Pool Federation rules).The main feature is a 60 second timer, that can provide a warning at 30 seconds.It shows how to correctly rack the balls before the frame starts, and can (optionally) assist in making the correct ruling following a break or time foul.The entire main area of the screen can be clicked to reset the timer, which vibrates to indicate that the timer has been reset. This makes it easy to time shots without having to look away from the table!Includes a timeout button and various settings.This app can also be used from an Android Wear device.Feedback/suggestions encouraged.
descriptionHTML:
This app helps you to umpire (referee) Eightball pool matches (using World Eightball Pool Federation rules).


The main feature is a 60 second timer, that can provide a warning at 30 seconds.
It shows how to correctly rack the balls before the frame starts, and can (optionally) assist in making the correct ruling following a break or time foul.


The entire main area of the screen can be clicked to reset the timer, which vibrates to indicate that the timer has been reset. This makes it easy to time shots without having to look away from the table!


Includes a timeout button and various settings.


This app can also be used from an Android Wear device.


Feedback/suggestions encouraged.
comments: Fantastic! Innovative! Well thought out! I really 'felt' the 'spin' on this app. What a cracker! Its such a welcome 'break' from usual 8 Balll Pool umpiring apps. Others just didn't think of all the requirements but this developer has really listened to every single 'tip'. He must have been in a great 'frame' of mind when writing it.

Easilly the best timer I've used. I love that i don't have to look at the phone after every shot or watch the phone when time is getting close.  However a more convenient way to pause the clock would be better. Maybe touch and holding with haptic feedback so the umpire does not have to look away from table. Well done.
How I don't know this app.... help me....!
I think its a bekaar App
Very nice All pool umpires should use this
Great app Really good including rules
